infile-option.name: path
infile-option.help: Path to fakealigner file (can be empty)

infile-option.name: path
infile-option.help: Path to faketree file (can be empty)

string-option.name: options
string-option.help: Options to be passed to FastTree.

outfile-option.name: exportconfig
outfile-option.help: Export the configuration to the specified file and exit. This is useful if you want to combine several configurations and command line settings into a single configuration file to be used in other analyses.

outfile-option.name: temporaries
outfile-option.help: directory that will be the parent for this job's temporary file

outfile-option.name: timesfile
outfile-option.help: optional file that will store the times of events during the SATe run. If the file exists, new lines will be

bool-option.name: aligned
bool-option.help: If used, then the input file be will treated as aligned for the purposes of the first round of tree inference (the algorithm will start with tree searching on the input before re-aligning). This option only applies if a starting tree is NOT given.

choice-option.name: datatype
choice-option.help: Specify DNA, RNA, or Protein to indicate what type of data is specified (if the input file format does not identify the datatype).

bool-option.name: keepalignmenttemps
bool-option.help: Keep even the realignment temporary running files (this only has an effect if keeptemp is also selected).

choice-option.name: missing
choice-option.help: How to deal with missing data symbols. Specify either "Ambiguous" or "Absent" if the input data contains ?-symbols

int-option.name: num_cpus
int-option.help: The number of processing cores that you would like to assign to SATe. This number should not exceed the number of cores on your machine.

int-option.name: max_mem_mb
int-option.help: The maximum memory available (for the Java heap size when running Java tools)

string-option.name: aligner
string-option.help: The name of the alignment program to use for subproblems.

string-option.name: merger
string-option.help: The name of the alignment program to use to merge subproblems.

string-option.name: tree_estimator
string-option.help: The name of the tree inference program to use to find trees on fixed alignments.

choice-option.name: break_strategy

choice.help: The edge that comes closest to dividing the tree into two equally sized subtrees (in terms of the number of leaves).

choice-option.help: The method for choosing an edge when bisecting the tree during decomposition

int-option.name: max_subproblem_size
int-option.help: The maximum size (number of leaves) of subproblems. When a subproblem contains this number of leaves (or fewer), then it will not be decomposed further.

number-option.name: max_subproblem_frac
number-option.help: The maximum size (number of leaves) of subproblems specified in terms as a proportion of the total number of leaves. When a subproblem contains this number of leaves (or fewer), then it will not be decomposed further.

bool-option.name: start_tree_search_from_current
bool-option.help: If selected that the tree from the previous iteration will be given to the tree searching tool as a starting tree.

bool-option.name: move_to_blind_on_worse_score
bool-option.help: If True then SATe will move to the blind mode as soon it encounters a tree/alignment pair with a worse score. This is essentially the same as running in blind mode from the beginning, but it does allow one to terminate a run at an interval from the first time the algorithm fails to improve the score.

bool-option.name: blind_mode_is_final
bool-option.help: When the blind mode is final, then SATe will never leave blind mode once it is has entered blind mode.

duration-option.name: blind_after_total_time
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) that SATe will run before switching to blind mode.

int-option.name: blind_after_total_iter
int-option.help: Maximum number of iterations that SATe will run before switching to blind mode.

duration-option.name: blind_after_time_without_imp
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) that SATe will run without an improvement in likelihood score before switching to blind mode.

int-option.name: blind_after_iter_without_imp
int-option.help: Maximum number of iterations without an improvement in likelihood score that SATe will run before switching to blind mode.

duration-option.name: time_limit
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) that SATe will continue starting new iterations of realigning and tree searching. If the number is less than 0, then no time limit will be used.

int-option.name: iter_limit
int-option.help: The maximum number of iteration that the SATe algorithm will run. If the number is less than 1, then no iteration limit will be used.

duration-option.name: after_blind_time_term_limit
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) that SATe will continue starting new iterations of realigning and tree searching after SATe has entered blind mode. If the number is less than 0, then no time limit will be used.

int-option.name: after_blind_iter_term_limit
int-option.help: The maximum number of iteration that the SATe algorithm will run after SATe has entered blind mode. If the number is less than 1, then no iteration limit will be used.

duration-option.name: time_without_imp_limit
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) since the last improvement in score that SATe will continue starting new iterations of realigning and tree searching. If the number is less than 0, then no time limit will be used.

int-option.name: iter_without_imp_limit
int-option.help: The maximum number of iterations without an improvement in score that the SATe algorithm will run. If the number is less than 1, then no iteration limit will be used.

duration-option.name: after_blind_time_without_imp_limit
duration-option.help: Maximum time (in seconds) since the last improvement in score that SATe will continue starting new iterations of realigning and tree searching after entering BLIND mode. If the number is less than 0, then no time limit will be used.

int-option.name: after_blind_iter_without_imp_limit
int-option.help: The maximum number of iterations without an improvement in score that the SATe algorithm will run after entering BLIND mode. If the number is less than 1, then no iteration limit will be used.

outfile-option.name: output_directory
outfile-option.help: directory for output files (defaults to input file directory)

bool-option.name: return_final_tree_and_alignment
bool-option.help: Return the tree and alignment pair from the last iteration (otherwise returns the best tree and alignment pair instead)
